兩.definition: two; both; some; a few; tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

兩下子.definition: a couple of times; to repeat the same; the same old trick; tricks of the trade

兩不相欠.definition: to be even; to be quits; to be even-steven

兩倍.definition: twice as much; double the amount

兩儀.definition: heaven and earth; yin and yang

兩全.definition: to satisfy both sides; to accommodate both (demands)

兩全其美.definition: to satisfy rival demands (idiom); to get the best of both worlds; to have it both ways; to have one's cake and eat it too

兩回事.definition: two quite different things; two unrelated matters

兩國相爭，不斬來使.pinyin: liang3 guo2 xiang1 zheng1 , bu4 zhan3 lai2 shi3
兩國相爭，不斬來使.definition: when two kingdoms are at war, they don't execute envoys (idiom)

兩宋.definition: the Song dynasty (960-1279); refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)

兩岸.definition: bilateral; both shores; both sides; both coasts; Taiwan and mainland

兩岸三地.definition: China, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau (media term used esp. since 1997)

兩廂情願.definition: both sides are willing; by mutual consent

兩廣.definition: the two provinces of Guangdong and Guangxi (traditional)

兩彈一星.definition: (China's achievements of) producing an atomic bomb (1964) and hydrogen bomb (1967) and launching a satellite into space (1970)

兩德.definition: two Germanies; refers to German Democratic Republic (East Germany) and the Federal Republic of Germany (West Germany)

兩性.definition: male and female; both types (acid and alkaline, positive and negative etc); (chemistry) amphoteric

兩情相悅.definition: (of a couple) to be harmonious; to be each other's sunshine

兩手.definition: one's two hands; two prongs (of a strategy); both aspects, eventualities etc; skills; expertise

兩手不沾陽春水.pinyin: liang3 shou3 bu4 zhan1 yang2 chun1 shui3
兩手不沾陽春水.definition: see 十指不沾陽春水|十指不沾阳春水[shi2 zhi3 bu4 zhan1 yang2 chun1 shui3]

兩敗俱傷.definition: both sides suffer (idiom); neither side wins

兩方.definition: both sides (in contract); the two opposing sides (in a dispute)

兩會.definition: National People's Congress and Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

兩棲.definition: amphibious; dual-talented; able to work in two different lines

兩極.definition: the two poles; the north and south poles; both ends of sth; electric or magnetic poles

兩江道.definition: Ryanggang province province in north North Korea, adjacent to Jilin province

兩河.definition: the areas to the north and south of the Yellow River (in the Spring and Autumn Period); Mesopotamia

兩清.definition: to square accounts (between borrower and lender or between buyer and seller)

兩湖.definition: Hubei 湖北 and Hunan 湖南 provinces

兩漢.definition: Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD); refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han

兩當.definition: Liangdang county in Longnan 隴南|陇南[Long3 nan2], Gansu

兩當縣.definition: Liangdang county in Longnan 隴南|陇南[Long3 nan2], Gansu

兩相情願.definition: both sides are willing; by mutual consent

兩碼事.definition: two things that are fundamentally different from each other; two very different things

兩端.definition: both ends (of a stick etc); two extremes

兩者.definition: both of them; the two of them

兩耳不聞窗外事.pinyin: liang3 er3 bu4 wen2 chuang1 wai4 shi4
兩耳不聞窗外事.definition: to pay no attention to outside matters

兩肋插刀.definition: lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom); fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it

兩著兒.definition: the same old trick; illegal device

兩虎相爭.definition: lit. two tigers fighting (idiom); fig. fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries

兩虎相爭，必有一傷.pinyin: liang3 hu3 xiang1 zheng1 , bi4 you3 yi1 shang1
兩虎相爭，必有一傷.definition: lit. if two tigers fight, one will get injured (idiom); fig. if you start a war, someone is bound to get hurt

兩虎相鬥.definition: lit. two tigers fight (idiom); fig. a dispute between two powerful adversaries; a battle of the giants

兩虎相鬥，必有一傷.pinyin: liang3 hu3 - xiang1 dou4 , bi4 you3 - yi1 shang1
兩虎相鬥，必有一傷.definition: lit. when two tigers fight, one will get injured (idiom); fig. if it comes to a fight, someone will get hurt

兩袖清風.definition: lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands; uncorrupted; unsoiled by corrupt practices

兩訖.definition: received and paid for (business term); the goods delivered and the bill settled

兩造.definition: both parties (to a lawsuit); plaintiff and defendant

兩重天.definition: two entirely different worlds; two contrasting realities

兩院.definition: two chambers (of legislative assembly), e.g. House of Representatives and Senate

兩難.definition: dilemma; quandary; to face a difficult choice

兩面三刀.definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross; double dealing and back stabbing

兩頭.definition: both ends; both parties to a deal

兩頭兒.definition: erhua variant of 兩頭|两头[liang3 tou2]

兩點水.definition: name of the "ice" radical 冫[bing1] in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15)
